Setting up widget in the main menu
Main menu settings
are not limited to selecting the composition and editing the order of menu items. Once the list is configured, it is also possible to add some widgets, which in turn display data from the external System and allow switching to the external System. For example, in the main menu, you can display the exchange rate or the weather forecast.
To add a widget to the main menu, open the "Widget" [SYS_MENU_WIDGET] object type by selecting the menu items: Administration → Object management → Object types, and go to the type registry (for more details see
Working with the object instance registry
).
Adding a new type instance is done using the
button located on the control panel. As a result, a card will open containing the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering a name for the setting.
Identifier
Entering the identification number of the generated action. The field can be filled in automatically.
Order
Entering the system number of the generated action. The field can be filled in automatically.
Icon
Selecting an icon from the drop-down list.
Type
Object type to display. The field is filled in automatically. The specified value is Widget.
Widget
Widget selection. Possible options:
•
Text
;
•
External Frame
.
Widget height, px
The field is available when the "
External Frame
" widget is selected.
This parameter sets the height of the frame, the value is specified in px.
Algorithm for external system link
The field is available when the "
External Frame
" widget is selected.
In this field, you can select an algorithm for setting a link to an external System from the drop-down list with a previously prepared algorithm, or add / edit an algorithm by clicking on the ellipsis icon.
Widget Text
The field is available when the "
Text
" widget is selected.
Enter text to display.
Localization settings. When pressed, a modal window will open, in which the name of the subject area is entered.
Input is available in different languages.
Display as title
The field is available when the "
Text
" widget is selected.
The attribute determines the display of text as a title.
Text color
The field is available when the "
Text
" widget is selected.
When using the parameter, the text color is set using the opened Color picker with the ability to select a color on the palette or enter a color code in HEX and RGBA formats.
Font size
The field is available when the "
Text
" widget is selected.
Fixing the font size (point size) of the text.
Module ID
Entering the ID of the object the card of which you want to display.
When selecting the "External Frame" Widget, it should be taken into account that displaying data from an external System is possible only if the external System allows data to be displayed in other Systems (on other sites).
To display the created objects and changes made in the settings of the Widgets menu item, refresh the browser page.
